problem.markdown:
>>Which of the following is true for a thermodynamic process? [select one or more]<<
[ ] It can always be represented by a curve on the state space. [x] The initial and final states in the process may be same. [x] The net change in all the properties of the system may be zero. [x] In a 2D state space, points representing the initial and final states may lie on the same horizontal line.
[explanation] A process can be represented as a curve only if it is quasi-static. Cyclic processes have zero net change in each property.The initial and final states of a general process are arbitrary. [explanation]
